newsitem.title: UK: Japanese stocks up in London as rate worries ease.
newsitem.headline: Japanese stocks up in London as rate worries ease.

text.p: Japanese stocks were slightly firmer in London, with interest mainly directed at interest rate sensitive sectors, traders said.
The Nikkei 50 average was up 1.50 points at 1,430.28 by 1254 GMT.
In Tokyo, the benchmark Nikkei 225 average finished 148.01 points higher at 21,275.02, boosted by the Federal Open Market Committee's decision to leave U.S. monetary policy unchanged.
"At the moment, worries about interest rates are out the window and that's helping the banks and heavy industry sectors," said one trader here.
"But there isn't enough interest or momentum to really push the market a lot higher," he added.
